H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H1238.def: = to act forcibly on something, ► so as to cause it to become waste and/or desolate

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H4676.def: = the part of a tree trunk left projecting from the ground after the rest has fallen or been felled

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H816.def: = state in which humans bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

H6202.def: literally: to neck; hence: = causative action by which humans kill animals by breaking their neck, which is normally done to unclean animals that, according to the law, cannot be sacrificed

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H4676.def: = the part of a tree trunk left projecting from the ground after the rest has fallen or been felled

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H422.def: = action by which someone invokes the name of a deity and ask him to punish a wrong-doer; ◄ contexts in which this may happen include: (1) covenants and agreements, where the deity is asked to punish those who do not obey the terms of the agreement, (2) cases  where a supposedly wrongful act has been committed, but where there is not enough certainty about the identity of the person who is responsible, and (3) in order to prevent people from committing a wrongful action, knowing that the deity's punishment will be upon them if they do so; ► the effectiveness of the curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H7219.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H8525.def: = long, narrow trench made in the soil by a plow

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H5697.def: = female young of a {L:cow<SDBH:פָּרָה>}; ► used as sacrifice

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H3649.def: = person serving a foreign deity as priest

H1523.def: mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2986.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or inanimate objects to move or be moved from one place to another

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H4503.def: = objects given to a person of high status; ► sometimes this is done on a voluntary basis as a show of respect for the recipient and in order to win that person's favor; in other cases this is done to fulfill the requirements imposed by the recipient

H3377.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = epithet for the king of Assyria denoting his high status

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H669.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H1317.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H1820.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H7110.def: = process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H8045.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H6975.def: = small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction

H1863.def: exact meaning unknown: = thorny plant growing in the {L:wilderness<SDBH:מִדְבָּר>}

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1390.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H5932.def: literally: sons of injustice; hence: = people that are engaged in unjust behavior

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H185.def: = state in which one senses a physical desire for food or sex; ◄ this desire is associated with one's {L:נֶפֶשׁ<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>} ≈ and can be both good and evil

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H631.def: = causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a rope, cord, or chain ► in order to keep them under control

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H669.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H5697.def: = female young of a {L:cow<SDBH:פָּרָה>}; ► used as sacrifice

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H1758.def: = causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2898.def: = state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H7702.def: = causative action by which someone breaks the soil with the help of a plow, pulled by domestic animals; ► to make it ready for cultivation; ≈ usually regarded as a strenuous task which requires much energy

141.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H5214.def: = to break up the ground with a plow; ≈ unplowed, fallow soil is associated with hardness and stubbornness

H5215.def: = small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>} and with a {L:wick<SDBH:פִּשְׁתָּה>} placed in it; sometimes placed on a {L:lampstand<SDBH:מְנֹורָה>}; used as a source of {L:light<SDBH:אֹור>}; ≈ associated with peace, stability and well-being

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H7562.def: = action by which humans or deities act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H3585.def: = state of having lost body volume

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

10.gl: to eat the fruits > to bear the consequences

H7588.def: = process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise

H4013.def: = area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H8020.def: = man, often identified with {L:Shalmaneser<SDBH:שַׁלְמַנְאֶסֶר>} III or Shalmaneser V, kings of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, or with Salmanu, king of {L:Moab<SDBH:מֹואָב>}; ► king who destroyed {L:Beth-Arbel<SDBH:בֵּית אַרְבֵאל>} ({A:ABD})

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1008.def: = town and cult centre, also referred to as {L:Beth-Aven<SDBH:בֵּית אָוֶן>} or simply {L:Aven<SDBH:אָוֶן>}; ◄ territory of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>}, near the border of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}

H7837.def: = the first appearance of light in the sky in the early morning

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H1820.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity
